intro: Aldama pachycephala, commonly known as the thick-headed Aldama, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a robust, woody stem with thick, fleshy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring and early summer. Aldama pachycephala is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
